Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row ofdata.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY,SEIS_PLAN, SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.
Column Comment.2: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.3: SEISMIC SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: Unique identifier for the service providedon a line.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SERVICE TYPE: A valid list of services for a businessassociate. For example well logger, drilling contractor, application developer. Forland, may be may be address for service, brokerage, maintainor etc.
Column Comment.6: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the business associate who is the contact forthe service.
Column Comment.7: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.8: DESCRIPTION: text desscription of the service provided.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: END DATE: The date that this service was completed.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: PROVISION ID: unique identifier for a contract provision
Column Comment.14: RATE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a business associate suchas a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Fee or rate schedules areoften used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided. .
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: REPRESENTED BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for the businessassociate who was represented, or on whose behalf the work was done. Used forsubcontracted work.
Column Comment.17: SERVICE DATE: date on which the service was provided
Column Comment.18: SERVICE QUALITY: the quality of service provided.
Column Comment.19: SERVICE REMARK: remarks about the service provided.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: START DATE: the date that this service was started.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
